content.rendered:
This Week in Genesis is coming to you from cold, wet and very wintery Melbourne, Australia. The beginning of this week marked our shortest day of the year and despite the intense urge to hibernate, I am excited that the days will slowly be getting longer.

This week also saw the release of WordPress 4.5.3.

While you’re all enjoying your summer sunshine on the other side of the world, here is the latest news happening around the Genesis Community online. Happy Reading 🙂

Themes

Jeremiah Grauke and StudioPress announced a beautiful new theme Maker Pro now available – read & see more about it here.

Bold and clean with plenty of space for your beautiful images, I’m looking forward to seeing the new sites that get a makeover with this theme.  (I’m sure one of my sites would love a new look 😉 )

Excited to see Maker Pro live in the wild! #genesiswp #wordpress #uidesign #webdesign https://t.co/laVoKjNieF

— JT Grauke (@jtgrauke) June 22, 2016

Introducing the Maker Pro theme, by @jtgrauke — https://t.co/F0rJvsUZax #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/NiqFdh6Ibv

— StudioPress (@studiopress) June 22, 2016

Jesse Petersen setting big expectations for the 4th of July – because sometimes you just have to set a hard deadline.

With the exception of the clients who have mini-projects underway, I’m focused on launching @_GenesisTheme before 4th of July. #genesiswp

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) June 18, 2016

Showcase

Three sites with a brand new makeover.

Dom Wint from Clean Page Design for Bigtank Video Production

Website redesign for Bigtank Video Production. Built with #WordPress + #genesiswphttps://t.co/CPAAypK8yu pic.twitter.com/fNXXBlacwd

— Dom Wint (@CleanPageDesign) June 21, 2016

…Claire Lobel from Liquid Moon for Cobalt Financial

New fully responsive website launched today for a mortgage company. https://t.co/CyG731sMEX #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/rd1zTMZHTt

— Claire Lobel (@clairelobel) June 20, 2016

Joelle Cottle from Format Creating for Greenleaf Accounting

Just launched, a fresh new design for @dhgreenleaf at https://t.co/iUsNdQKHSa. Love this design! #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/fYrfTjWEbj

— Joelle Cottle (@joellecottle) June 23, 2016

Podcasts

Jackie D’Elia announced a new podcast coming soon with the promise of plenty of Genesis talk – Rethink.fm

Best of the rest

This week’s essential reading (especially if you’re new to the Genesis Framework) is from Nathan Rice on the importance of using a child theme with Genesis.

Why You Should Always Use a Child Theme with Genesis

From Bill Erickson this week:

Relative Date Lengths in Genesis

Anita C from Cre8tive Diva has a great tutorial

How to Enable Rich Pins without Using Yoast in Genesis

From Imagely, a post on social sharing options for your site

Encouraging Social Sharing Of Your Content & Offer Social Proof

From fellow Melbournian Nicholas Duell in response to the recent WooCommerce update

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, WooCommerce Account page tweak for Genesis themes by @NicholasDuell https://t.co/9SvK2oFLGo

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) June 23, 2016

 

New tutorials from Sridhar this week

  • How to implement smooth scrolling on your site
  • A tutorial for Altitude Pro to show site title on the home page and logo on inner pages
  • How to replace the front page 1 background image with a video in Aspire Pro

Smooth scrolling to top in Genesis after clicking anchor links in headings

How to set up site title on homepage and logo on inner pages in Altitude Pro

How to replace Front Page 1 background image in Aspire Pro with a Video

Birthday Shout outs

Birthdays this week for two lovely ladies that are a big part of the Genesis community (& they make the web a prettier place to be):

Happy Birthday to Lindsay Riel from Pretty Darn Cute Design for last weekend ??

And Happy Birthday to Lauren Gaige from Restored 316 for yesterday ??

That’s it for this week. It’s my first time being the guest editor here, so if I missed something, make sure to add your news to the front page of GenesisWP.guide so it can be covered in next weeks edition.

Thank you to Nick for inviting me to collate this week’s news – it’s given me a new view into the GenesisWP world 🙂

PS I know Australia is a really long way from, well, everywhere, but if you’re planning a visit down under, I’m always happy to meet new Genesis peeps. And if you love coffee, then Melbourne is definitely the place to come.

excerpt.rendered: Guest editor Helena Denley with news on a gorgeous new third party theme on StudioPress, a new podcast, and a round-up of the latest (and greatest) Genesis tutorials.
